meanings.definition: The act of engrafting or the state of being engrafted.
meanings.sent1: The engraftments of new ideas into the curriculum brought fresh perspectives to the students.
meanings.sent2: The engraftments of apple tree branches onto pear trees resulted in hybrid fruits.
meanings.sent3: The engraftments of humor into the serious lecture lightened the mood in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her engraftments of creativity onto traditional recipes transformed them into culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The engraftments of teamwork and collaboration among the employees boosted productivity in the office.

meanings.definition: Something that is engrafted, as a shoot or scion.
meanings.sent1: The gardener carefully tended to the engraftments on the young sapling.
meanings.sent2: The engraftments on the rose bush displayed a beautiful array of colors.
meanings.sent3: The engraftments on the tree seemed to whisper secrets to the passing breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her engraftments on the painting added depth and complexity to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The engraftments on the quilt created a stunning patchwork of patterns.
